model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: YES! You get it. Now I want to go to an ice cream shop. I might apply for a part-time job at an ice cream shop since I'm not working.  Do you enjoy your job as a fry cook? I think the food & restaurant industries may be similar.

[MEMORY]
1. Speaker A plans to try the famous hamburgers made by Speaker B at the diner.
2. Speaker B has invented a chilli dog casserole that Speaker A wants to try.
3. Speaker B is also a high school student preparing for college, working at a diner at night.
4. Speaker B works on weekends at a research lab, showing an interest in neuroscience.
5. Speaker A and Speaker B are involved in different fields of work, cooking and lab research.
6. Speaker B had hamburgers for dinner with cheese, mustard, and lettuce.
